subject: Re: testing void methods
msgSnippet: But what if you re not allowed to see the code?  That is, what if you re testing the implementation of a vendor s code who s source you can neither see nor
messageBody:
But what if you're not allowed to see the code? That is, what if
you're testing the implementation of a vendor's code who's source you
can neither see nor modify? (True, you can always decompile it to
get an idea, but it wouldn't be kosher to modify that and still
validate/invalidate a test result)

Just a thought.

-Adam

--- In junit@y..., Alain Ravet <alain.ravet.list@w...> wrote:
> Jay,
>
> When testing mercilessly, or writing code test first,
> it is not rare to modify production - non test - code to make it
more
> testable.
>
> "Modify", in this case, could mean
> - returning a value, or
> - adding a parameter, or
> - storing some result related data and adding an accesor to it.
>
> Alain Ravet
>
> > I am new to this junit testing. I am trying to test void methods.
> > What is the best way of doing this.
> >
> > e.g i am testing a method:
> >
> > void dispatchEvent(Event event)
> >
> > which inside calls handleEvent(event) , in a class called Handle
> > (this is also a void method)
